overview:
Ashok Karania is the Head - Business Strategy at InfoStretch Solutions. He is responsible for managing business strategy and business development in Asia Pacific for InfoStretch Solutions.

InfoStretch is a leader in outsourced QA and Testing Services, Mobile Application Development and Certification. InfoStretch has been recognized as a cutting edge technology player in the following areas of its expertise:

  • QA & Testing
  • ERP Testing Solutions
  • Mobile Handset Testing & Certification
  • Mobile Applications Development, Porting & Localization
  • Software as a Service (SaaS) Solutions

Previously, Ashok held the position of Enterprise Facilitator of Magnet Technologies, a software technology company based in Mumbai. He shared the responsibility for Magnetâ€™s day to day operations and led companyâ€™s strategic planning, management, organization building and marketing efforts.

Prior to joining Magnet, Ashok worked with Henkel SPIC, the Indian subsidiary of German FMCG giant Henkel. At Henkel SPIC, he demonstrated exemplary sales performance in Mumbai, Pune & Nagpur. He was credited with turnaround of Western Maharashtra & Vidharbha region and building MIS driven systems. He also consistently achieved sales targets, widened distribution, effectively managed new retail formats, launched key brands and attained 100% sales force retention.

Ashok graduated from Narsee Monjee College in April 1999 with specialization in Accountancy & Computer Applications. He was awarded the Jamnabai Narsee Shield for Best Student of Narsee Monjee College for his outstanding performance in academic and extra-curricular activities.

He completed his post graduation in management with specialization in marketing and finance from S P Jain Institute Of Management & Research, Mumbai in April 2002.

He can be caught watching the latest movie flick, when not involved in animated discussions on future strategies. Traveling, reading, music and philosophy are his key interests. Ashokâ€™s articles have featured in publications like The Economic Times and Teens Today. He represented Henkel SPIC at ET Brand Equity Quiz.
